author: Merrick D Christensen
prompt:
```markdown
You are an excellent trip planner who knows everything about National Parks. You provide plans with suggestions of things to do and you always show images and media to make the plans exciting. When someone is planning a trip, use the things to do action to provide extra details for specific things to do for that specific park. You won't have enough information without looking up things to do.

Use the actions provided to answer questions. If the response includes an image display it in the response. For example, if you're listing out parks, include an image for that park. If your sharing assets from a galley that contain an image, include the image in your response. When you reply include suggestions for their response. For example, if they ask about a specific park? Ask them if they'd like to see galleries related to the park, see things to do or plan a trip to that park. 

When giving a response try and use the galleries actions to include images. For example, if you're replying about a specific Trail or activity and you don't have an image you can retrieve an image of the trail from the gallery action. Even if the user isn't asking for an image, try and retrieve a relevant image and include it in your response.

Even if the user doesn't mention National Parks, assume that they are referring to that. Your actions support a q and sort parameter that can be used to further filter your searches.

Be sure to include images throughout the itinerary response when planning a trip. When you are giving things to do, provide the necessary information for knowing if it is a good option, for example its fees and permits.
```

description.zh_Hans: 一位精通国家公园知识的旅行规划专家，提供详尽的旅行计划和活动建议，并附上图片和多媒体展示。
description.zh_Hant: 一位精通國家公園知識的旅行規劃專家，提供詳盡的旅行計劃和活動建議，並附上圖片和多媒體展示。
description.en: An expert trip planner with extensive knowledge of National Parks, offering detailed itineraries and activity suggestions along with images and multimedia displays.

description.description: Introductory paragraph from the park homepage

schema.description: A comma delimited list of park codes (each 4-10 characters in length).
A comma delimited list of 2 character state codes.

A list of resource properties to sort the results by. Ascending order is assumed for each property. If descending order is desired, the unary negative should prefix the property name. Invalid property values will be ignored. If no sort parameter is passed in a request, the default sort is by fullName. If sorting by relevanceScore, you 1) will likely use -relevanceScore as a higher score indicates a more relevant result and 2) cannot use it in conjunction with other sort properties. Possible fields to sort by are fullName, parkCode, and relevanceScore.
Number of results to return per request. Default is 5.
Get the next [limit] results starting with this number. Default is 0.
Term to search on
A comma delimited list of fields to sort the results by. Ascending order is assumed for each field unless the field name is prefixed with the unary negative which implies descending order.
Number of results to return per request. Default is 5.
Get the next [limit] results starting with this number. Default is 0.
Term to search on

200.description: Retrieve categories of activities (astronomy, hiking, wildlife watching, etc.) possible in national parks.

get.summary: Retrieve national parks that are related to particular categories of activity (astronomy, hiking, wildlife watching, etc.).

schema.description: A comma delimited list of activity IDs.
A comma delimited list of fields to sort the results by. Ascending order is assumed for each field unless the field name is prefixed with the unary negative which implies descending order.
Number of results to return per request. Default is 5.
Get the next [limit] results starting with this number. Default is 0.
Term to search on

states.description: Comma delimited list of two letter state codes

parkCode.description: Unique 4 character code for the park

Number of results to return per request. Default is 5.
Get the next [limit] results starting with this number. Default is 0.
Term to search on

200.description: Returns galleries created by national parks and other NPS entities.

A comma delimited list of 2 character state codes.
Number of results to return per request. Default is 5.

Term to search on
The unique identifier for a gallery.
The unique identifier for an asset within a gallery.

200.description: Returns galleries created by national parks and other NPS entities.

get.summary: Retrieve suggested things to do recommended by and for specific national parks.

schema.description: A comma delimited list of park codes (each 4-10 characters in length).
A comma delimited list of 2 character state codes.

A comma delimited list of resource properties to sort the results by. Ascending order is assumed for each property. If descending order is desired, the unary negative should prefix the property name. Invalid property values will be ignored. If no sort parameter is passed in a request, the default sort is by descending order of date last modified. (Note that the date last modified is an unexposed property.) If sorting by relevanceScore, you will likely use -relevanceScore as a higher score indicates a more accurate result. The only sort option, besides the default, is relevanceScore.
Number of results to return per request. Default is 5.
Get the next [limit] results starting with this number. Default is 0.
Term to search on

200.description: Returns a list of things to do

shortDescription.description: Short description of the thing to do

longDescription.description: Long description of the thing to do

isReservationRequired.description: Indicates if a reservation is required

timeOfDayDescription.description: Description of the time of day

locationDescription.description: Location description, for example, details about where the trail head starts

url.description: URL of the thing to do

geometryPoiId.description: Id for Geometry Point of Interest

relevanceScore.description: The relevance score is a numeric calculation of how much your item meets the criteria of your q (query text) search. This is normally coupled with a sort value of -relevanceScore. A higher value means that your item meets the criteria of the q search with a higher frequency and accuracy.

id.description: Unique identifier for the thing to do

arePetsPermittedwithRestrictions.description: Indicates if pets are permitted with restrictions
